section_title: Variables and Data Types in Python
section_description: A hands-on programming section where students learn to store and manipulate different kinds of data in Python. They will master variable assignment, explore fundamental data types, and perform basic operations through practical exercises.
learning_objectives: Define and assign values to variables using proper naming conventions
Identify and use the core data types: integers, floats, strings, and booleans
Perform type conversion between different data types
Combine variables and data types in basic expressions and print statements

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to create variables, assign values to them, and use them in simple print statements.
key_topics: Variable assignment with the equals sign
Python variable naming rules and conventions
Using the print() function to display variable values

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create three variables: one for your name (string), one for your age (integer), and one for your height in meters (float). Print each variable on a separate line.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to create strings, use escape characters, and perform basic string concatenation.
key_topics: Defining strings with single and double quotes
Using escape sequences for newlines (\n) and tabs (\t)

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create a variable `greeting` with the value 'Hello', a variable `name` with your name, and a variable `punctuation` with the value '!'. Concatenate them into a single string and print the result. Next, create a multi-line string using the newline character and print it.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to perform arithmetic operations with integers and floats, and understand the difference between the two.

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create two number variables. Calculate and print their sum, difference, product, and quotient. Ensure one calculation uses integer division (//) and one uses the modulo operator (%) to show the remainder.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to create boolean variables and use comparison operators to evaluate expressions.

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create two variables with numeric values. Write print statements that output the result of the following comparisons: whether they are equal, whether one is greater than the other, and whether their sum is greater than 10.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to convert variables between string, integer, and float types using built-in functions.
key_topics: The str(), int(), and float() functions
When and why type conversion is necessary
Handling potential errors with invalid conversions

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create a variable `year` as a string, e.g., '2024'. Convert it to an integer, add 1 to it, and then convert the result back to a string. Print the original string, the integer after addition, and the final string in a single sentence using concatenation.
